title: Mimori Yusa - almost complete discography
description:
Mimori Yusa (Ã©ï¿½Å Ã¤Â½ï¿½ Ã¦Å“ÂªÃ¦Â£Â®), born February 20, 1964 in Sendai in Miyagi Prefecture, is a Japanese singer-songwriter with a very prolific career and perceived as having peculiar lyrics and melody. The uniqueness of her angelic voice along with the sheer abundance of her songs have earned her a respected position in the Japanese music world, a position which might easily be called a genre in itself.

MimoriÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s originality when it comes to live performance deserves attention. Not only does she perform at concert halls, she also holds an annual series of concerts, to coincide with the blossoming of peach trees to celebrate Ã¢â‚¬Å“Girls FestivalÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, a Japanese tradition of celebrating the birth of baby girls. These concerts feature special guests with whom Mimori holds a live session. In addition, she sings songs, sometimes nostalgic songs, which she feels like singing, not only her own creations. Another type of performance is entitled Ã¢â‚¬Å“BonbonniereÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. This is a piano solo type of concert held in a casual atmosphere. It features Mimori conversing with the audience, and is infused with her unique brand of humor. It is said that these informal gatherings are somewhat addictive.


MimoriÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s major hits include "Chizu o kudasai" (Give me a Map), used in 1989 in a Nisshin Cup Noodle commercial featuring Arnold Schwarzenegger, and Ã¢â‚¬Å“KuroÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, used in 2005 on an NHK program, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Minna no UtaÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½.
